snippet: The Westchester County city may eventually have to consider bankruptcy or letting a control board oversee its finances, a member of a special study commission says.
abstract: Report shows that Yonkers, New York State's fourth-largest city, faces an $89 million shortfall for the next fiscal year, and $465 million over the following three years; former Assemblyman Richard Brodsky, one of the report's authors, warns that without state intervention, Yonkers may have to explore options that could include bankruptcy or a fiscal control board.
lead_paragraph: The Westchester County city may eventually have to consider bankruptcy or letting a control board oversee its finances, a member of a special study commission says.
